Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SerialRS232::SerialRS232 ( const char *  dev,
const baudrates &  baudrate = b9600,
const parities &  parity = noparity,
const databits &  databitsnum = data8,
const stopbits &  stopbitsnum = stop1,
const int &  termc = 10,
const unsigned int &  buflen = 1024,
const int &  timeout = 300 
) throw (SerialRS232Exception &)

Constructor.

Opens the serial port for a communication according to the RS232 protocol.

Parameters:
dev device to be opened (char *).
baudrate input-output baud rate (enum). Defaults to b9600.
parity specifies if parity is used or not. If used, parity must be odd or even (enum). Defaults to noparity.
databitsnum number of data bits per byte. Must be data5, data6, data7 or data8 (enum). Defaults to data8.
stopbitsnum number of stop bits. Must be stop1 or stop2 (enum). Defaults to stop1.
termc frame termination character (int). Defaults to 10 ('
'). If termc < 0 this condition is ignored.
buflen maximum number of characters to be read (unsigned int). Defaults to 1024.
timeout maximum time in centisecs for a reading operation (int). Defaults to 300. If tout <= 0 this condition is ignored.
